Issues.Title: Porting bug fix: Smart Tag window does not render at all\correctly on secondary monitor when PMA is enabled
Issues.Body:
**Issue:** When PMA mode is enabled, smart tag window does not render correctly or some of the options in the window are not accessible through mouse. It happens because of DPI awareness context mismatch between the control window and its corresponding mouse hook.

**Fix**: Determine DPI awareness context of the control window and set it in its mouse hook.

**Note:** This fix is a port from net fx runtime

**Testing done:** Since smart tags is a design time feature and is not supported by netcore designer yet, it cannot be tested. However I ran few sample netcore apps and ensured that there is no regression.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Porting bug fix: Smart Tag window does not render at all\correctly on secondary monitor when PMA is enabled" (#1331)

Issues.Title: Add MyType to VB WinForms template
Issues.Body:
This is needed in support of getting VB code that uses My.* working out of the box.

Sync with @KathleenDollard on the correct content, but I think we want the following:
``` xml
<PropertyGroup>
  <MyType>Console</MyType>
</PropertyGroup>
```
Eventually we will want MyType=WindowsForms that you get in the classic VB WPF project, but Console is what works now.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add MyType to VB WinForms template" (#1346)

Issues.Title: Replace DpiAwarenessContext enum with Windows DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT everywhere in the code
Issues.Body:
All the P/Invokes for DPI related APIs work with DPI_AWARENESS or DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT.
It is incorrect to use our own DpiAwarenessContext enum. 

We need to update P/Invoke headers of all such APIs and update all code invocations appropriately.

For more discussion check: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1331
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Replace DpiAwarenessContext enum with Windows DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT everywhere in the code" (#1344)

Issues.Title: Move ResXResourceWriter out of System.Windows.Forms
Issues.Body:
In Entity Framework 6, we need to [generate resx files](https://github.com/aspnet/EntityFramework6/blob/6.2.0/src/EntityFramework.PowerShell/Migrations/Utilities/MigrationWriter.cs#L69-L72) at design time.

Now that we're porting to .NET Core, it's infeasible for us to depend on System.Windows.Forms.

Would it be possible to move this type to the existing System.Resources.Writer assembly in corefx or even just its own new package independent of Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App? (e.g. System.Resources.ResX)

cc @divega @ajcvickers @Pilchie
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Move ResXResourceWriter out of System.Windows.Forms" (#1342)

Issues.Title: Form.FormBorderStyle == SizeableToolWindow not working.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: Preview 6
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:** Setting FormBorderStyle to SizeableToolWindow is not working.

**Actual behavior:** Same caption bar height as a Sizeable form.

**Expected behavior:** The caption bar should be narrower, as in .NET Framework.

**Minimal repro:**: change the property in the main form of a minimal project, change its FormBorderStyle, run and compare.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form.FormBorderStyle == SizeableToolWindow not working." (#1338)

Issues.Title: `ImageCollectionEditor` unable to add an image at runtime
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes/No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

Having ported `ImageCollectionEditor` code from NETFx, it appears impossible to add an image at run-time via `ImageCollectionEditor`.
The error appears in both NET Fx (4.7.2/4.8) and NET Core implementations.

It is however possible to add an image via the editor at design-time.
I've checked the VS implementation and it also appears to be the same as in latest NET Fx.

Relates to #1273 

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

- to a dynamically created `ImageList`:
![ImageCollectionEditor-net472](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/60952218-34c2eb00-a33e-11e9-8fe5-b98f1fc4f28d.gif)

- to an `ImageList` created at the design time
![ImageCollectionEditor-net472-designer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/60953292-3ee5e900-a340-11e9-9498-dda666110255.gif)



**Expected behavior:**

It is possible to add an image at run-time

**Minimal repro:**

https://github.com/RussKie/Test-ImageCollectionEditor/issues/1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`ImageCollectionEditor` unable to add an image at runtime " (#1335)

Issues.Title: WIP: Accessibility: Fixing MenuStrip items control type property
Issues.Body:
Fixes #1328 

## Proposed changes
- Change control type property for items of first MenuStrip layer

### Before
Menu items of first MenuStrip layer have control type property as "menu item"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60996511-65fee380-a35d-11e9-8b0b-cf397ffe0320.png)

### After
Menu items of first MenuStrip layer have control type property as "menu"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60996526-6a2b0100-a35d-11e9-926f-bd5f29e7d78f.png)

## Accessibility testing  
- Used the Inspect tool to check control type property of items

## Test environment(s) 
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18362.175]
- .NET Core SDK. Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012264
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP: Accessibility: Fixing MenuStrip items control type property" (#1329)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' in MenuStrip
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.1-preview8-012981
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Problem description:**
*User Experience:*  
User who depends on screen reader won't be able to get the correct purpose of the controls on tool, if Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' on SSMA.

**Repro steps:**
1. Create new .Net Core app
2. Add MenuStrip control to Form
3. Add some items to MenuStrip
4. Open the Inspect tool and look on control type of items of the first MenuStrip layer

**Actual behavior:** 
Incorrect control type 'Menu item' is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...'. Control type 'Menu item' is defined for file and under file controls also defined menu item.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60995150-9e50f280-a35a-11e9-8099-16c34113689e.png)


**Expected behavior:**
Correct control type only 'Menu' should be define for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60995195-b0cb2c00-a35a-11e9-9273-8491d2d1e111.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' in MenuStrip" (#1328)
